commit_message:
configure ovs bridge in openvswitch-db container

- this change moves the ovs_ensure_configured.sh  file to the
  openvswitch-db container.
- this change reorders the plays in ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/start.yml
  to configure the ovs bridges before starting the vswitchd container.

Change-Id: Ied1a82d48377534c15680406df9a96caf3b79515
Closes-Bug: #1522133

subject: Remove py26 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 08:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove py26 support

As of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I6420a95a58c85830412ae5792208d952116ca7e6
Closes-Bug: 1519510
"}]
commit_message:
Remove py26 support

As of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I6420a95a58c85830412ae5792208d952116ca7e6
Closes-Bug: 1519510

commit_message:
Code change for test case of removing _get_tenant_id_for_create()

As _get_tenant_id_for_create() is duplicated with process in
prepare_request_body(), it is not needed in the code. Patch[1]
has been submmitted to avoid duplicated code. This patch will
change code of testcase to meet the requirement of patch[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/241984/

Change-Id: Iafbada4a4232736116d7a61b5612de5ca8d473f6
Close-Bug: #1513825

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-16 11:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_eswitch_manager.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/eswitch_manager.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/pci_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/sriov_nic_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_pci_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "[RFC] mech_sriov: vf cleanup on delete

Currently, in sriov setup VFs doesn't get cleaned up after
port deletion. Specifically, MAC and VLAN configuration that
was previously assigned stays untouched and gets changed
only next time when this device will be allocated.

This could lead to unexpected results, for example, user could
create a port with MAC address of some deleted port, but as
the VF of that specific deleted port wasn't cleaned up, user
could end up with two VFs with the same MAC address for example.

I have some concerns about this implementation (hence RFC in
commit title).

 * I had to modify port_delete interface in ml2.rpc to pass
   the port object instead of port_id as we need binding:profile
   information (specifically, PCI address) to clean things up
   and going back and forth from agent to plugin doesn't sound
   optimal. Not sure if such change is OK though.

 * It looks like this implementation could be a subject for possible
   races. For example:
     - plugin issues an async rpc cast to an agent
       and marks port deleted and device unallocated.
     - in the meantime, user starts a VM with new direct port
     - in the meantime, agent figures out pf/vf name from pci address
       and prepares to run 'ip link' command to erase settings from the vf
     - if user's VM wins the race and starts earlier, agent will flush
       its interface configuration.

 * I wasn't able to figure out a 'clean' way to reset MAC on VF.
   The closest thing that works is 'if link set .. vf .. mac 0'. It
   sets a MAC like '00:00:00:00:00:71'. However, I wasn't able to
   find any real issues that it's not '00:00:00:00:00:00' except
   that it looks a little strange.

Fixes bug #1475256
Change-Id: Ifd33fbf9736cf636a37bdda8f48730ebe1a04e2d
"}]
commit_message:
[RFC] mech_sriov: vf cleanup on delete

Currently, in sriov setup VFs doesn't get cleaned up after
port deletion. Specifically, MAC and VLAN configuration that
was previously assigned stays untouched and gets changed
only next time when this device will be allocated.

This could lead to unexpected results, for example, user could
create a port with MAC address of some deleted port, but as
the VF of that specific deleted port wasn't cleaned up, user
could end up with two VFs with the same MAC address for example.

I have some concerns about this implementation (hence RFC in
commit title).

 * I had to modify port_delete interface in ml2.rpc to pass
   the port object instead of port_id as we need binding:profile
   information (specifically, PCI address) to clean things up
   and going back and forth from agent to plugin doesn't sound
   optimal. Not sure if such change is OK though.

 * It looks like this implementation could be a subject for possible
   races. For example:
     - plugin issues an async rpc cast to an agent
       and marks port deleted and device unallocated.
     - in the meantime, user starts a VM with new direct port
     - in the meantime, agent figures out pf/vf name from pci address
       and prepares to run 'ip link' command to erase settings from the vf
     - if user's VM wins the race and starts earlier, agent will flush
       its interface configuration.

 * I wasn't able to figure out a 'clean' way to reset MAC on VF.
   The closest thing that works is 'if link set .. vf .. mac 0'. It
   sets a MAC like '00:00:00:00:00:71'. However, I wasn't able to
   find any real issues that it's not '00:00:00:00:00:00' except
   that it looks a little strange.

Fixes bug #1475256
Change-Id: Ifd33fbf9736cf636a37bdda8f48730ebe1a04e2d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-04 16:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Don't generate testr logs in func tests

Currently the devstack-gate post hook that implements functional
testing processes the output from testr into HTML and compresses
it.  Devstack-gate itself does almost the exact same steps:

 http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh?id=997283aae10500065c3637647438b00e9d24abed#n571

Because of this, we end up with these files:

./testr_results.html.gz
./logs/testr_results.html
./logs/testr_results.html.gz

The duplication is obviously not necessary, and the fact that there
is an uncompressed file defeats the purpose of compressing them,
and finally, the infra-root team gets notified of errors by our
maintenance scripts which try to compress the .html files again
and can not.

This change removes the processing of testr output from the post
test hook in favor of the version in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Ib6cfa588dd05c0f58bde83a5eed63d1075e6a206
"}]
commit_message:
Don't generate testr logs in func tests

Currently the devstack-gate post hook that implements functional
testing processes the output from testr into HTML and compresses
it.  Devstack-gate itself does almost the exact same steps:

 http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh?id=997283aae10500065c3637647438b00e9d24abed#n571

Because of this, we end up with these files:

./testr_results.html.gz
./logs/testr_results.html
./logs/testr_results.html.gz

The duplication is obviously not necessary, and the fact that there
is an uncompressed file defeats the purpose of compressing them,
and finally, the infra-root team gets notified of errors by our
maintenance scripts which try to compress the .html files again
and can not.

This change removes the processing of testr output from the post
test hook in favor of the version in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Ib6cfa588dd05c0f58bde83a5eed63d1075e6a206

commit_message:
Unify strongswan driver configuration

Move FedoraStrongswan driver into strongswan driver. Do not let user
decide which strongswan driver should be used, but automatically return
the correct one.

Change-Id: I9e1e95f2845363dd8791667ec3e0a958a2d82af2

commit_message:
Add L3 HA fullstack failover test

* Generate unique internal and external router device names
  using the agent's hostname. This is to allow multiple HA
  router replicas to co-exist on the same machine, otherwise
  they'd all use the same device names and OVS would freak out.
* Add host.disconnect method that disconnects the host from
  the central internal and external bridges, simulating pulling
  the cable from the host's NIC.
* Added a L3 HA failover test.
* Renamed fullstack/test_l3_agent to fullstack/test_l3.
* Removed the functional failover test, moved the other tests
  in its class to the other class in the module.

Change-Id: I250fa41d89dfc4f9f3ba4c03a027b52b2e8c4b4b

subject: [WIP] Add MTU support for FedoraStrongSwan driver
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 7293, 'name': 'Elena Ezhova', 'email': 'ezhovaelena19@gmail.com', 'username': 'elena'}, {'_account_id': 14216, 'name': 'Cisco vpnaas CI', 'email': 'vpnaas.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_vpnaas_ci'}, {'_account_id': 15226, 'name': 'Bharath M', 'email': 'bharath.stacker@gmail.com', 'username': 'bharath'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 16:21:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'etc/vpn_agent.ini', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/template/strongswan/strongswan.conf.template', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/fedora_strongswan_ipsec.py'], 'message': "[WIP] Add MTU support for FedoraStrongSwan driver

StrongSwan supports setting mtu as well as OpenSwan with two major
differences:
    * StrongSwan allows setting the 'mtu' option only per vpn service
      (not per connection)
    * This option is not supported on Ubuntu version of StrongSwan
      (5.1.2) as it was introduced only in ver. 5.2.1

Add a config option 'mtu' for FedoraStrongSwan driver. This option
will be used to set up mtu in strongswan.conf and the mtu parameter
of an ipsec site connection will be ignored (maybe throw exception
if it is set?). Reloading config files in ensure_configs would allow
to update mtu value on the run.
As StrongSwan on Ubuntu doesn't support setting MTU, the config option
is added only for FedoraStrongSwan driver.

An alternative may be to enforce all ipsec connections belonging to
the same vpn service to have the same mtu, but that would involve
making db queries from driver on ipsec site connection create and
update operations which is more hacky and complicated.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1478949
Change-Id: Ic980fc7076a70ffa4af63a2f9ee2085d3ea4db16
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add MTU support for FedoraStrongSwan driver

StrongSwan supports setting mtu as well as OpenSwan with two major
differences:
    * StrongSwan allows setting the 'mtu' option only per vpn service
      (not per connection)
    * This option is not supported on Ubuntu version of StrongSwan
      (5.1.2) as it was introduced only in ver. 5.2.1

Add a config option 'mtu' for FedoraStrongSwan driver. This option
will be used to set up mtu in strongswan.conf and the mtu parameter
of an ipsec site connection will be ignored (maybe throw exception
if it is set?). Reloading config files in ensure_configs would allow
to update mtu value on the run.
As StrongSwan on Ubuntu doesn't support setting MTU, the config option
is added only for FedoraStrongSwan driver.

An alternative may be to enforce all ipsec connections belonging to
the same vpn service to have the same mtu, but that would involve
making db queries from driver on ipsec site connection create and
update operations which is more hacky and complicated.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1478949

commit_message:
Continue adding high-level functional/integration DVR tests

This is a contunious effort of patch 178880.  This patch only
covers functional test cases on floating IP, gateway port, and
router related operations.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 02:00:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Floatingip_agent_gw_port delete failure with DVR

Floatingip_agent_gw_port delete throws a server fault
error when trying to delete the port, since it could
not find the "_delete_port" function with ML2Plugin.

This was causing the Tempest test on FloatingIPsTestJSON
to fail on couple of tests.

This patch fixes the above mentioned problem by calling
the right public functions instead of calling the
internal private functions.

Change-Id: I052fca07e2f13c805bcb09301a6bd05449554355
Closes-Bug: #1475011
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Floatingip_agent_gw_port delete failure with DVR

Floatingip_agent_gw_port delete throws a server fault
error when trying to delete the port, since it could
not find the "_delete_port" function with ML2Plugin.

This was causing the Tempest test on FloatingIPsTestJSON
to fail on couple of tests.

This patch fixes the above mentioned problem by calling
the right public functions instead of calling the
internal private functions.

Change-Id: I052fca07e2f13c805bcb09301a6bd05449554355
Closes-Bug: #1475011

commit_message:
Remove unused payload parameter

routers_updated doesn't use its 'data' parameter, no point
in sending anything. I did not want to remove the parameter
entirely as I don't know if it's used by out of repo projects.

Change-Id: I64d45159da11b13b70232f5af376a546f9f2e889

commit_message:
[neutron-db-manage] Add check for branches

Check that migrations from contract branch doesn't contain create/add
alembic commands and migrations from expand branch doesn't contain
drop commands.

Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

Related-bug: #1490767

Change-Id: Ifb7bc4b272d7c8de3282019f53f9f618e8f5c158

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-05 05:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Update HA Router state to backup before deletion

When admin_state_up of an L3 Agent hosting HA router is set to False, Neutron
deletes the HA router from the agent, and one of the backup HA routers would
take over the role of Master. In such a situation, when we query the active
agent hosting HA router, we see the same old state for the HA router on that
agent.

This patch fixes the issue by sending out the state change notification just
before terminating the HA Router.

Closes-Bug: #1481588
Change-Id: Iad7a953de23a5126fe16f20410fd94f61da83fb7
'}]
commit_message:
Update HA Router state to backup before deletion

When admin_state_up of an L3 Agent hosting HA router is set to False, Neutron
deletes the HA router from the agent, and one of the backup HA routers would
take over the role of Master. In such a situation, when we query the active
agent hosting HA router, we see the same old state for the HA router on that
agent.

This patch fixes the issue by sending out the state change notification just
before terminating the HA Router.

Closes-Bug: #1481588
Change-Id: Iad7a953de23a5126fe16f20410fd94f61da83fb7

commit_message:
Linuxbridge agent pass the config as parameter

Instead of using the global cfg.CONF, we enable linuxbridge agent
to pass the config as parameter like openvswith agent.
This is very useful to test the agent without having to override
the global config.

Closes-Bug: #1493424
Change-Id: I4c0ef5be9c87c9bf4e5d71bc73889881a3a10ef7

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2015-07-15 20:35:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': "Use 1st SNAT DVR host name for FIP assoc w/unbound

Floating agent gw port is only created for compute host when floating
IP is associated with a VM resided on this host. If associate neutron
port with floating IP before booting a VM with that port, floating
agent gw port won't be created (in case this is the first VM scheduled
to a compute host).

In that case l3 agent on compute host will receive router info with
floating ip but no floating agent gw port: it will subscribe the
router for fip namespace but namespace itself won't be created

In order to have floating agent gw port created in unbound port
scenario, a host has to be assigned to the unbound port during
floating IP association process. The fix is to pick the first snat dvr
host name as there is no compute host at this point.  Once this issue
gets taken care of, floating agent gw port will be created when
floating IP associated with this unbound port. And fip namespace can
be created successfully after VM is on that unbound port.

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
Partial-Bug: #1447034
"}]
commit_message:
Use 1st SNAT DVR host name for FIP assoc w/unbound

Floating agent gw port is only created for compute host when floating
IP is associated with a VM resided on this host. If associate neutron
port with floating IP before booting a VM with that port, floating
agent gw port won't be created (in case this is the first VM scheduled
to a compute host).

In that case l3 agent on compute host will receive router info with
floating ip but no floating agent gw port: it will subscribe the
router for fip namespace but namespace itself won't be created

In order to have floating agent gw port created in unbound port
scenario, a host has to be assigned to the unbound port during
floating IP association process. The fix is to pick the first snat dvr
host name as there is no compute host at this point.  Once this issue
gets taken care of, floating agent gw port will be created when
floating IP associated with this unbound port. And fip namespace can
be created successfully after VM is on that unbound port.

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
Partial-Bug: #1447034

commit_message:
Add updated_attrs in port_update

port_update notification is sent when an attribute
of a port is modified. The OVS agent uses
that notification to keep track of the ports that
need to be reprocessed. Anyway not all the changes
that can affect a port require the port to be
reprocessed. Add updated_attrs in port_update to
keep track of which attribute was updated. The
L2 agent uses that list to determine if a port
needs to be reprocessed or if updating the firewall
is enough.

Change-Id: I0ce3527a2f218f3fda231f724b82a68e031a23be
Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent

commit_message:
db_base: Make delete_port raise NotFound if port is not found

Previously, if one called delete_port() and the port was not found
in the db the caller would not know. This patch updates the code
so that a PortNotFound exception is raised instead so the caller
knows that the port has already deleted.

Change-Id: I4737dc33ea32c2f90e7a050f2705d068041bbeaf
related-bug: #1496554

In '_modify_rules' method of iptables_manager.py, rules_index(first rule

rules_index value is determined early in the function and recalculated

commit_message:
Simplifies logic in _modify_rules

In '_modify_rules' method of iptables_manager.py, rules_index(first rule
position) can be determined in the later part of the method. Currently
rules_index value is determined early in the function and recalculated
again depending on the changes to filter.

This patch simplifies the logic by determining the 'rules_index' only
after the rules filter has the final data.

Closes-Bug: #1488747
Change-Id: I07aebbe552399e26e3dfd081827e3cf88d7f031c

commit_message:
Remove cache of registered ports in the OVS agent

The OVS agent doesn't need to keep track of which port has
processed anymore since it consumes the events provided by
ovsdb monitor.
scan_ports and scan_ancillary_ports are called only if a resync
is needed, modify those methods to return all ports currently on
the machine as added ports.
Unit tests are modified accordingly.

Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent
Change-Id: Icfd7a2b7bfe30ce0d28808fefd6e3a360ebbe062

commit_message:
Refactor tunnel_sync to handle race conditions

We have a concern that we may have race conditions with existing
tunnel_sync logic with delete endpoint.

This patch-set introduces the update endpoint methods for updating
the values in VXLAN/GRE endpoint tables.

As part of code refactoring this patch-set improves the logging in
tunnel_sync for better debuging and troubleshooting.

The detailed problem statement is available in the bug description.
Closes-Bug: #1426427

Change-Id: Ic119d14e4d6a2d6d04c4288b9b0242475adf55d6

commit_message:
bind port maybe endless in the concurrent thread

the variable level may be greater than MAX_BINDING_LEVELS in
 concurrent thread,then the loop will be endless
 when the port can not be binded.

Change-Id: I0c183fc6a53e327af4a6e7a2202a2904eefce1c4

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE - test change

This is to test that neutron changes will run VPN funcitonal tests,
initially experimental, and then later as part of check and gate.

This patch has a change in Neutron that will cause VPN functional
test for strongswan (at least) to fail. Rebased to latest Neutron.

This version does NOT have the hack, and tests should pass.

Part of the neutron-lib work.

Change-Id: Ibc4d22799287c756341c2ee332b47047d2985d83
Depends-On: Ieea93753e352ccb09f65aac12c8c81c1d96593ac

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE - test change

This is to test that neutron changes will run VPN funcitonal tests,
in the check queue.

This patch has a change in Neutron that will cause VPN functional
test for strongswan (at least) to fail. It is testing against
stable/kilo to verify that the job works there.

Part of the neutron-lib work.

Change-Id: I8beec9e95f9c2d288eef6e6f75ece62e870112c2
Depends-On: Ieea93753e352ccb09f65aac12c8c81c1d96593ac

Make the sample local.conf file conform to modern standards
and inline the webserver.sh file into local.sh.

commit_message:
[WIP] Linux Bridge: Create a configurable network manager class

Create a superclass that LinuxBridgeManager inherits from, and create a
configuration option for the Linux Bridge Agent to allow other types of
VIF plugging strategies (like macvtap) to co-exist within the Linux
Bridge agent.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/071416.html

Change-Id: Ic15c4839c54fa1645953bcccdd14279838e5c816
Related-Bug: #1468803

commit_message:
Exception will not be raised when Port Security is not enabled

if port_data.get(psec.PORTSECURITY) is None, the variable
 port_security is True, so AddressPairAndPortSecurityRequired
exception will not be raised for ever.

Change-Id: I7e9a8022adcdfdc30c3fc528ed84b6570c8df291

I've wondered why this is here.  The network_id is redundant with the
subnet_id because the subnet_id is a UUID and associates with the
network.

"}]
commit_message:
WIP Remove explicit network_id from IPAllocation

I've wondered why this is here.  The network_id is redundant with the
subnet_id because the subnet_id is a UUID and associates with the
network.

A quick look through the code where IPAllocation is queried, there are
a handful of places where the network_id is used in the filter but
subnet_id is always supplied too.  I don't see any queries that need
to filter on it.

Change-Id: I90abb88306ce43dfb7fcb7decb0c40b7c8f55e46

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-18 23:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/plugins/brocade/db/models.py', 'doc/source/devref/effective_neutron.rst', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/db/qos/api.py', 'neutron/db/address_scope_db.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/metering/metering_db.py', 'neutron/db/flavors_db.py'], 'message': 'Avoid the select and delete sql pattern

The following pattern:

 selected = session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).one()
 context.session.delete(selected)

is commonly used in Neutron but racy because selected can be deleted
between the select and the delete.

We should prefer the non-racy pattern:

 # we set synchronize_session=False because the selected row is no more
 # used in session context
 count = (session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).
          delete(synchronize_session=False))
 if not count:
     raise NotFound

except when sqlalchemy "after_delete" events are used to trace deletes
in model table. Indeed the 2 patterns raise different sqlalchemy events:

* Session.delete(1st pattern) raises "after_delete" events
* Query.delete(2nd pattern) raises "after_bulk_delete" events

And at the moment, neutron uses sqlalchemy "after_delete" events to track
resource quotas[1].

This change replaces when possible the 1st pattern by the 2nd pattern or
explicits why we should use 1st pattern.

[1] neutron.quota.resource

Closes-Bug: #1496586
Change-Id: Ic5136e2a9d6a6fc5a12a81ca4c2a5f9f1450901d
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid the select and delete sql pattern

The following pattern:

 selected = session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).one()
 context.session.delete(selected)

is commonly used in Neutron but racy because selected can be deleted
between the select and the delete.

We should prefer the non-racy pattern:

 # we set synchronize_session=False because the selected row is no more
 # used in session context
 count = (session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).
          delete(synchronize_session=False))
 if not count:
     raise NotFound

except when sqlalchemy "after_delete" events are used to trace deletes
in model table. Indeed the 2 patterns raise different sqlalchemy events:

* Session.delete(1st pattern) raises "after_delete" events
* Query.delete(2nd pattern) raises "after_bulk_delete" events

And at the moment, neutron uses sqlalchemy "after_delete" events to track
resource quotas[1].

This change replaces when possible the 1st pattern by the 2nd pattern or
explicits why we should use 1st pattern.

[1] neutron.quota.resource

Closes-Bug: #1496586
Change-Id: Ic5136e2a9d6a6fc5a12a81ca4c2a5f9f1450901d

This patch adds the command line support for
vlan-aware-vms subports.

DocImpact
APIImpact

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-27 21:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py'], 'message': 'Make it possible for subclasses of Idl to be used

The OVS library now allows registering a notification hook by
subclassing the Idl class and defining a notify() method. To
be able to use this in both Neutron and networking-ovn, it must
be possible for the Connection object to use a subclassed Idl.

This patch allows either an Idl object to be passed to the
Connection, or for the library user to subclass Connection and
override the create_idl method.

The plan is for Neutron to be able to use this to avoid having to
spawn ovsdb-client monitor for syncing. networking-ovn will use

Change-Id: I8d2884fe32f9ccdcd7539366e0baf055a232f2cd
'}]
commit_message:
Make it possible for subclasses of Idl to be used

The OVS library now allows registering a notification hook by
subclassing the Idl class and defining a notify() method. To
be able to use this in both Neutron and networking-ovn, it must
be possible for the Connection object to use a subclassed Idl.

This patch allows either an Idl object to be passed to the
Connection, or for the library user to subclass Connection and
override the create_idl method.

The plan is for Neutron to be able to use this to avoid having to
spawn ovsdb-client monitor for syncing. networking-ovn will use
this to notify neutron of port status changes.

Closes-Bug: #1449263
Change-Id: I8d2884fe32f9ccdcd7539366e0baf055a232f2cd

L3 agents internal_network_added function and
_dvr_internal_network_removed function makes a call
to get_snat_port-for_internal_port in the case of
DVR routers.

But there are duplicate calls to the same function

'}]
commit_message:
Avoid duplicate calls to get_snat_port_for_internal_port

L3 agents internal_network_added function and
_dvr_internal_network_removed function makes a call
to get_snat_port-for_internal_port in the case of
DVR routers.

But there are duplicate calls to the same function
when snat is configured for the router interface.

This patch avoids the duplicate calls.

Closes-Bug: #1499045

Change-Id: If6e119e10fd6af5824500e298f788fe90f2e6aed

commit_message:
[WIP] Logging API for security group and firewall rule

We would like to implement a logging API for security group and firewall rule
in order to make the trouble shooting process easier for operators
(or Cloud admins, developers etc).

This is implementation for the RFE that is tracked by [1]
and based on specification by [2]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1468366
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203509/

Change-Id: I44837e31a713b6f2d20aa07bc38ef67265543d1a
Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
GreenThread should be created when network admin_state is up

the GreenThread that configure dhcp should be created when
 admin_state is up, that is to say network.admin_state_up
 is True in function sync_state. no need to create
greenthread when admin_state is down.

Change-Id: Idf36d15e84aac631fa14909d78f2abd9b8958ee8
Closes-bug: #1497570.

commit_message:
Avoid adding flood flow when l2pop is enabled
When ovs agent start, it should not add tunnel flood flow when l2pop is enabled, because later when port is up, plugin will instructs ovs agent to install the corresponding fdb entry
Fixes Bug1312257

Change-Id: I7a44be0d12b18fc3378a4a26d8f605257d04954b

commit_message:
Use constants directly from neutron.common.constants in l3_db

Use constants directly from neutron.common.constants in l3_db
instead of defining a local constant pointing to the one in
neutron.common.constants.

Recently there was a patch that fixed constants in l3_dvr_db,
but did not touch the l3_db and this patch does the job.

Change-Id: I19c6d6d659036b6ef5762da6186c6af601cfc216

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-06 07:45:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "leave skipped updated devices in 'current'

In function 'treat_devices_added_or_updated', if updated device
just removed from br-int before processing it, the device added
into 'skipped_devices', and the device removed from the set of
'current', the device's sg rules never removed from iptables.

This patch leave skipped updated devices in set of 'current',
let ovs_agent removing all sg rules about these devices.

Closes-Bug: #1489690
Change-Id: I1c211545fe6c1d5c4f13f3550b7a07f461c2b1ad
"}]
commit_message:
leave skipped updated devices in 'current'

In function 'treat_devices_added_or_updated', if updated device
just removed from br-int before processing it, the device added
into 'skipped_devices', and the device removed from the set of
'current', the device's sg rules never removed from iptables.

This patch leave skipped updated devices in set of 'current',
let ovs_agent removing all sg rules about these devices.

Closes-Bug: #1489690
Change-Id: I1c211545fe6c1d5c4f13f3550b7a07f461c2b1ad

commit_message:
Allocate segment id fail with concurrency requests

Start multi neutron-server and create vxlan network with 1000
concurrency requests, but 200 return with success.

Change-Id: I4c2ea926b699af6ea4a8104fef09c2b002486dec
Closes-Bug: #1418283

commit_message:
Avoid stacktrace when dhcp port is deleted

When a dhcp port is deleted using the neutron API, dhcp agent
dumps lots of stacktrace messages (which makes debugging gate
failures a bit difficult) and re-creates the dhcp port.
This patch modifies the stacktrace to a simple warning and retains
the current behavior of re-creating [1] the dhcp-port in such situations.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/commit/?id=9d80002

Closes-Bug: #1477190
Change-Id: I7e8ef4edd320a0f8cd6fa51ff50140435e8f1f12

commit_message:
To support ICMP codes in range [0,255]

firewall rules doesn't support to set port/port range in
 range [0,255] when selecting ICMP protocol. ICMP codes
should support to be set in range [0,255]

Closes-Bug: #1492547

Change-Id: Id2325bc7658125926053fb6aca8def4a9233f8de

an arp entry for the DVR routers.

This might happen if the device was concurrently
deleted or when the device was not created.
So it makes sense to check for the device before
trying to update an arp entry in the namespace.

If the device does not exist log a warning
message instead of throwing an exception.

This patch fixes the problem seen in the log
trace.

Related-Bug: #1419175
Change-Id: I128b9d2172690ac6854e05582fa3f05fb0ca876b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cannot find device "qr" while updating arp

Logtrace for l3 agent shows errors related to
"cannot find device qr" while trying to update
an arp entry for the DVR routers.

This might happen if the device was concurrently
deleted or when the device was not created.
So it makes sense to check for the device before
trying to update an arp entry in the namespace.

If the device does not exist log a warning
message instead of throwing an exception.

This patch fixes the problem seen in the log
trace.

Related-Bug: #1419175
Change-Id: I128b9d2172690ac6854e05582fa3f05fb0ca876b

as requiring UUIDs.

APIImpact

Closes-Bug: #1470076

commit_message:
Make subnet_id for lbaas v2 member create optional

Presently subnet id is required for creating lbaas v2 member.
This patch makes subnet id optional for creating the member

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: I2b0619eee8dfad05c5824cf8c1f4d3f8ffd77c26

commit_message:
[WIP] Linux Bridge Agent Restructuring

Basically I want the Linux Bridge agent to become like the
OVSNeutronAgent, which inherits from the RPC mixins, rather than having
a two separate classes with some interesting interactions between.

Merge LinuxBridgeRpcCallbacks and LinuxBridgeNeutronAgentRPC into a
class - LinuxBridgeNeutronAgent.

Related-Bug: #1468803
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Scheuring <andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I3473d256009e89defc7a1b6bdb33448fdec451ac

subject: Update LBaaS L7 extension spec to reflect reality
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-27 00:49:48.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/lbaas-l7-rules.rst'], 'message': 'Update LBaaS L7 extension spec to reflect reality

Now that we are actually implementing Neutron LBaaS L7 functionality,
we have discovered a few discrepancies between what this spec
describes, and what we are actually having to code. This update should
bring the spec in line with what we are actually coding.

Change-Id: Iec33c480bedfb3f1504751a35bc405c5100432ef
'}]
commit_message:
Update LBaaS L7 extension spec to reflect reality

Now that we are actually implementing Neutron LBaaS L7 functionality,
we have discovered a few discrepancies between what this spec
describes, and what we are actually having to code. This update should
bring the spec in line with what we are actually coding.

Change-Id: Iec33c480bedfb3f1504751a35bc405c5100432ef

commit_message:
Register net-update options to show help info

Register net-update options to show help info. For bool type
attributes, two options are introduced like --enable and --disable
to avoid manually passing bool parameters, similar to subnet-update
commmand.

Change-Id: I3fe1e4ca90d31b43c9ed2cf47e520b862d618a43
Closes-Bug: #1406386

commit_message:
Output resource uuid when a resource is created

the log output mechanism has been already implemented in oslo.log[1],
this patch just adds "resource" information to log.

Followings are sample executed "neutron net-create".
 *configure file
   logging_context_format_string =
       %(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(color)s%(levelname)s %(name)s
       [%(request_id)s %(user_name)s %(project_id)s%(color)s]
       %(resource)s%(color)s%(message)s

 *souruce file
  rscdict = {'type': 'network',
             'id': '8e6a748c-aa8a-440b-904a-a6e2f6dc00eb'}
  LOG.debug("network create success", resource=rscdict)

 *log file
  DEUG [req-1667753a-e5f5-4417-bd8d-16f12bcc2e34 admin
       0862ba8c3497455a8fdf40c49f0f2644] [network-8e6a748c-
       aa8a-440b-904a-a6e2f6dc00eb] network create success

 [1]
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144813/

Change-Id: I789cefa4d1b742562d3d54e25f0932032e74dd68
Closes-Bug: #1468723

commit_message:
IP Address Auto-Completion with FWaaS Command

Neutron FWaaS currently allows users to specify IP addresses
in incomplete formats in commands such as
"neutron firewall-rule-create", but does not translate it into
the complete format -- for example, if a "--source-ip-address"
is set to "1/32", it will be registered in the database as "1/32",
instead of "1.0.0.0/32". The patch ensures that the IP address is
registered in the complete format.

because it is complemented by FW rule creation from the horizon or
other neutron commands,
fwaas complements the IP address as well as their
such as the options to specify the IP address
is set the "1/32", and it is registered as "1.0.0.0/32" on database
the case of the above example.

Change-Id: I494f84d6ba318264d747f983904130841f1e2c19

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Trying out Guru Meditation Report

I posited that it would be nice to have a way to get a thread dump (a-la
JVM) on a running process then realized we have Guru Meditation Reports
in oslo_reports.

To fire handler kill -s SIGUSR1 [pid].

Change-Id: If288ef2392388dc7079c6aa739446928187f97db

commit_message:
add a default value for the variable core_plugin

a default value should be added for the variable
core_plugin, which will make it easier to configure
neutron service.

Change-Id: I7c749073a388bc77f95b794cbaee67998cbfa7e6

commit_message:
Change log level warn to debug to avoid frequent warn

"No DHCP agents available, skipping rescheduling" is reported
 so frequently in function remove_networks_from_down_agents when
 there is none active agent.the log is not very useful but so
 many log will make it difficult to read log information.

Closes-bug: #1492773

Change-Id: I7a1524834c8f970381e40681f532bf8d9916693e

subject: Only use lsb_release for distro tags
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 23:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['tools/create-stack-user.sh', 'clean.sh', 'tools/info.sh', 'functions-common', 'unstack.sh', 'tools/install_prereqs.sh', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Only use lsb_release for distro tags

The existing GetOSVersion has a lot of unused code which is wrong in
several ways

 - the only path tested in upstream CI is with lsb_release, because
   it's pre-installed on all nodes

 - the /etc/redhat-release checking probably still works, but is
   unnecessary

 - If using lsb_release, os_UPDATE has never actually been set.

 - the /etc/SuSE-release branch checking is broken if the lsb package
   is actually installed.  lsb checking does not set os_UPDATE but yet
   the SuSE DISTRO setting relies on this to set a patch level (and so
   does some of the rpm tags).  SuSE 11 is up to update 3, but the rpm
   matching is stuck hard-coded to update 2.  I'm guessing
   installation is actually broken there.

 - the debian checking branch is broken.  The VERSION tags have been
   removed and were not supposed to be relied on anyway (see notes in
   [1])

This simplifies things:

 - remove OSX checking (moved here after discussions in
   I31d0fdd30928ecc8d959a95838b1d3affd28ac6f)

 - only use the output of lsb_release.

 - A small best-effort check to pre-install lsb packages if not
   detected (that avoids chicken-egg-problem of package-install
   wrappers relying on os_* flags).

 - The unset os_UPDATE is removed.  It's only previous use was for
   setting separate suse versions in the DISTRO element for matching
   during package installs (since removed) -- the same could be
   achieved by parsing os_RELEASE if required.

[1] http://sources.debian.net/src/base-files/7.5/debian/changelog/

Change-Id: I46a2c36d95327087085df07cb797eb91249a893c

foo

Change-Id: Iefe4bb61a6e25ecf7aa07639332329352139a38f
"}]
commit_message:
Only use lsb_release for distro tags

The existing GetOSVersion has a lot of unused code which is wrong in
several ways

 - the only path tested in upstream CI is with lsb_release, because
   it's pre-installed on all nodes

 - the /etc/redhat-release checking probably still works, but is
   unnecessary

 - If using lsb_release, os_UPDATE has never actually been set.

 - the /etc/SuSE-release branch checking is broken if the lsb package
   is actually installed.  lsb checking does not set os_UPDATE but yet
   the SuSE DISTRO setting relies on this to set a patch level (and so
   does some of the rpm tags).  SuSE 11 is up to update 3, but the rpm
   matching is stuck hard-coded to update 2.  I'm guessing
   installation is actually broken there.

 - the debian checking branch is broken.  The VERSION tags have been
   removed and were not supposed to be relied on anyway (see notes in
   [1])

This simplifies things:

 - remove OSX checking (moved here after discussions in
   I31d0fdd30928ecc8d959a95838b1d3affd28ac6f)

 - only use the output of lsb_release.

 - A small best-effort check to pre-install lsb packages if not
   detected (that avoids chicken-egg-problem of package-install
   wrappers relying on os_* flags).

 - The unset os_UPDATE is removed.  It's only previous use was for
   setting separate suse versions in the DISTRO element for matching
   during package installs (since removed) -- the same could be
   achieved by parsing os_RELEASE if required.

[1] http://sources.debian.net/src/base-files/7.5/debian/changelog/

Change-Id: I46a2c36d95327087085df07cb797eb91249a893c

foo

Change-Id: Iefe4bb61a6e25ecf7aa07639332329352139a38f

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Change-Id: I5eb5d3a017ef752178073d7389961fd0ff4be4c4
Closes-Bug: #1368661

subject: Fix PostgreSQL root functions
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-19 23:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/root.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/status.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/config.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/users.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/pgutil.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix PostgreSQL root functions

The default PostgreSQL administration account is 'postgres'.

This account always exists and cannot be removed.
Its attributes and access can however be altered.

Clients can connect from the localhost or remotely via TCP/IP:

Local clients (e.g. psql) can connect from a preset *system* account
called 'postgres'.
This system account has no password and is *locked* by default,
so that it can be used by *local* users only.
It should *never* be enabled (or it's password set)!!!
That would just open up a new attack vector on the system account.

Remote clients should use a build-in *database* account of the same
name. It's password can be changed using the "ALTER USER" statement.

Access to this account is disabled by Trove exposed only once the
superuser access is requested.

In the current implementation Trove uses the 'postgres' account and
return a new superuser called 'root' when the root access is requested.
The user 'root' has however no special meaning in PostgreSQL and the
existing applications may rely on the default superuser name 'postgres'.

This patch includes the following fixes:

 - Make Trove create and use its own administrative account (os_admin).
 - Disable (disable logins) the built-in 'postgres' account by default.
 - Enable and return the 'postgres' user when the root access is
   requested.
 - Fix failure on repeated 'root-enable' calls. The new implementation
   just regenerates the user's password.
 - Prevent users from hijacking the 'os_admin' account by allowing only
   local access.
 - Use the existing framework to generate secure passwords.
 - Stop using the system 'postgres' user to execute command-line client
   calls. Communicate with database via a native Python interface
   (like other datastores) instead.
 - Remove unnecessary complex result-set caching on the guest.
 - Simplify the status-checking code using the native exceptions.
   Avoid performing complex checks with uncertain benefits
   (i.e. attempt to guess the state of the process).

Notes:

 The current implementation is broken for variaous reasons:

 - It uses UUIDs in place of 'secure' password.
 - It creates a 'root' user, but no database for it.
   The clients won't be able to authenticate without explicitly
   providing an existing database name.
 - The created 'root' user has no 'SUPERUSER' attribute and
   hence is not a real superuser (cannot perform certain tasks)...
 - The implementation suffers a defect that allows a non-root user
   gain root access to an instance without marking is as 'root-enabled'
   A similar defect exists in other datastores (MySQL) too:

     1. Create an instance.
     2. Enable root.
     3. Use your root access to change the password of the built-in
        'postgres' account (Trove will still work because it uses the
        'peer' authentication method - the UNIX account).
     4. Login as 'postgres' using the changed password and drop the
        created 'root' account.
     5. Backup & restore the instance.
     6. Trove reports the root has never been enabled (it checks for
        existence of superuser accounts other than the built-in
        'postgres').
     7. You enjoy the root access of the 'postgres' user
        (the password is not reset on restore).

Depends-On: I9d6b3df5bebc3c499cea8306f5a1a6bab18adef6
Change-Id: Ie56ac0850bf4de742ce7841195ce29ca3b30c9ef
Closes-Bug: 1514569
'}]
commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL root functions

The default PostgreSQL administration account is 'postgres'.

This account always exists and cannot be removed.
Its attributes and access can however be altered.

Clients can connect from the localhost or remotely via TCP/IP:

Local clients (e.g. psql) can connect from a preset *system* account
called 'postgres'.
This system account has no password and is *locked* by default,
so that it can be used by *local* users only.
It should *never* be enabled (or it's password set)!!!
That would just open up a new attack vector on the system account.

Remote clients should use a build-in *database* account of the same
name. It's password can be changed using the "ALTER USER" statement.

Access to this account is disabled by Trove exposed only once the
superuser access is requested.

In the current implementation Trove uses the 'postgres' account and
return a new superuser called 'root' when the root access is requested.
The user 'root' has however no special meaning in PostgreSQL and the
existing applications may rely on the default superuser name 'postgres'.

This patch includes the following fixes:

 - Make Trove create and use its own administrative account (os_admin).
 - Disable (disable logins) the built-in 'postgres' account by default.
 - Enable and return the 'postgres' user when the root access is
   requested.
 - Fix failure on repeated 'root-enable' calls. The new implementation
   just regenerates the user's password.
 - Prevent users from hijacking the 'os_admin' account by allowing only
   local access.
 - Use the existing framework to generate secure passwords.
 - Stop using the system 'postgres' user to execute command-line client
   calls. Communicate with database via a native Python interface
   (like other datastores) instead.
 - Remove unnecessary complex result-set caching on the guest.
 - Simplify the status-checking code using the native exceptions.
   Avoid performing complex checks with uncertain benefits
   (i.e. attempt to guess the state of the process).

Notes:

 The current implementation is broken for variaous reasons:

 - It uses UUIDs in place of 'secure' password.
 - It creates a 'root' user, but no database for it.
   The clients won't be able to authenticate without explicitly
   providing an existing database name.
 - The created 'root' user has no 'SUPERUSER' attribute and
   hence is not a real superuser (cannot perform certain tasks)...
 - The implementation suffers a defect that allows a non-root user
   gain root access to an instance without marking is as 'root-enabled'
   A similar defect exists in other datastores (MySQL) too:

     1. Create an instance.
     2. Enable root.
     3. Use your root access to change the password of the built-in
        'postgres' account (Trove will still work because it uses the
        'peer' authentication method - the UNIX account).
     4. Login as 'postgres' using the changed password and drop the
        created 'root' account.
     5. Backup & restore the instance.
     6. Trove reports the root has never been enabled (it checks for
        existence of superuser accounts other than the built-in
        'postgres').
     7. You enjoy the root access of the 'postgres' user
        (the password is not reset on restore).

Depends-On: I9d6b3df5bebc3c499cea8306f5a1a6bab18adef6
Change-Id: Ie56ac0850bf4de742ce7841195ce29ca3b30c9ef
Closes-Bug: 1514569

commit_message:
carbonara: move aggregated() to AggregatedTimeSerie

The plan is to deprecate TimeSerieArchive, so this patch moves the
aggregated method that we will still need to AggregatedTimeSerie. The
method now deals directly with AggregatedTimeSerie rather than
TimeSerieArchive, but works in the same way.

Change-Id: I62bde8b5972387ba33f9ef58ef664aebbe059056

commit_message:
Anchor support to Octavia

Use Anchor for certificate signing to make the octavia communication
more secure. Anchor Ref url: https://github.com/openstack/anchor

Co-Authored-By: bharath <bharath.stacker@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: German Eichberger <german.eichberger@hp.com>

Change-Id: Id77b2b1540377db661f15d4eeafc4922f446d987

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I7e279cbb3a6c4710b8361c8cc2df368bd28c3203
Closes-Bug: #1489059

patch fixes it.

TrivialFix

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 19:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'keystone_user fails if auth_url ends with '/' in Openrc

Having /root/openrc with
OS_AUTH_URL='http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/' (notice the "/" at the end)
makes keystone_user password verification fails.

Change-Id: If321bae1aa235ef6e6c7faead32c8056c81252dc
Closes-Bug: #1522550
'}]
commit_message:
keystone_user fails if auth_url ends with '/' in Openrc

Having /root/openrc with
OS_AUTH_URL='http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/' (notice the "/" at the end)
makes keystone_user password verification fails.

Change-Id: If321bae1aa235ef6e6c7faead32c8056c81252dc
Closes-Bug: #1522550

subject: Functional: only copy logs on exception
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-03 02:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/functional/python_client_base.py', 'magnum/tests/contrib/copy_instance_logs.sh'], 'message': "Functional: only copy logs on exception

This patch adds a copy_logs as the handler with unittest's addOnException,
by doing this, we can get logs for all failed cases instead of copy them
before teardown.

If without any failed case, don't copy logs for saving time.

Partially implements: blueprint swarm-functional-testing
Change-Id: I47725d0d16735f650adf325adcf4194eb70c384d
"}]
commit_message:
Functional: only copy logs on exception

This patch adds a copy_logs as the handler with unittest's addOnException,
by doing this, we can get logs for all failed cases instead of copy them
before teardown.

If without any failed case, don't copy logs for saving time.

Partially implements: blueprint swarm-functional-testing
Change-Id: I47725d0d16735f650adf325adcf4194eb70c384d

- Use image_utils to retrieve an image's virtual_size on the fly.
- Fix race conditions happened when multiple bootable volumes are

Closes-Bug: #1498965
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ZFSSA drivers' local cache bugs

- Use image_utils to retrieve an image's virtual_size on the fly.
- Fix race conditions happened when multiple bootable volumes are
created and deleted simultaneously.
- Handle a situation in iSCSI driver when custom schema are deleted.

Change-Id: I588fb6c668f2a891ab24d89fea26536dd0cd5742
Closes-Bug: #1498965

remove version from setup.cfg

commit_message:
Start removal of namespace package

This moves the namespace package to akanda_neutro, and adds a shim
which allows neutron to still load the plugins with the old path.
Shim can be removed once devstack plugin is updated.

Change-Id: Ie06f2087dceeff91bebd32bd33901950a282f792
Partially-Implements: blueprint convert-to-astara

commit_message:
Register neutron client option

1. Register neutron_client_opts
2. Updated config sample to include neutron opts

subject: Detach vopt from mappings if VM is live
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 17:26:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/media.py'], 'message': "Detach vopt from mappings if VM is live

AIX can't handle having its VOpt mapping removed while it's live.  We
can see VIOS errors like:

HTTP error 500 for method POST on path
/rest/api/uom/VirtualIOServer/656B0AC3-35D4-4E06-892E-FD3EACA09737?gro
up=ViosSCSIMapping: Internal Server Error -- [PVME0105FF05-0187] Command
drmgr -c slot -s 'U8247.22L.212E63A-V6-C3' -r returned 1. Additional
messages:
0931-029 The specified slot contains a device or devices that are
currently configured. Unconfigure the following device or devices with
the rmdev command and try again.

In this change set, we check whether the VM is live, and if so, rather
than deleting the mapping entirely, we remove the Storage and
TargetDevice fields, thus detaching the storage from the mapping.

Change-Id: I9205f471628788fc7e5230bee0944b2c2434c1d2
"}]
commit_message:
Detach vopt from mappings if VM is live

AIX can't handle having its VOpt mapping removed while it's live.  We
can see VIOS errors like:

HTTP error 500 for method POST on path
/rest/api/uom/VirtualIOServer/656B0AC3-35D4-4E06-892E-FD3EACA09737?gro
up=ViosSCSIMapping: Internal Server Error -- [PVME0105FF05-0187] Command
drmgr -c slot -s 'U8247.22L.212E63A-V6-C3' -r returned 1. Additional
messages:
0931-029 The specified slot contains a device or devices that are
currently configured. Unconfigure the following device or devices with
the rmdev command and try again.

In this change set, we check whether the VM is live, and if so, rather
than deleting the mapping entirely, we remove the Storage and
TargetDevice fields, thus detaching the storage from the mapping.

Change-Id: I9205f471628788fc7e5230bee0944b2c2434c1d2

Some operating systems are unable to remove a device when it is in use.
However, during a live migrate, we can't migrate the the virtual optical
device.

The current live migrate code was removing the virtual optical media,
but also was removing the mapping.  This change updates it to leave the
mapping (so that operating systems that can't remove the bus are OK),
but to detach the vopt device from it.  We still remove the virtual

Change-Id: Id2a3216ec06e95a538fa2f9f25463c490d69f81f

commit_message:
Don't remove vOpt mapping on live migrate

Some operating systems are unable to remove a device when it is in use.
However, during a live migrate, we can't migrate the the virtual optical
device.

The current live migrate code was removing the virtual optical media,
but also was removing the mapping.  This change updates it to leave the
mapping (so that operating systems that can't remove the bus are OK),
but to detach the vopt device from it.  We still remove the virtual
optical media.

Change-Id: Id2a3216ec06e95a538fa2f9f25463c490d69f81f
Closes-Bug: 1522222

commit_message:
Don't remove vOpt mapping on live migrate

Some operating systems are unable to remove a device when it is in use.
However, during a live migrate, we can't migrate the the virtual optical
device.

The current live migrate code was removing the virtual optical media,
but also was removing the mapping.  This change updates it to leave the
mapping (so that operating systems that can't remove the bus are OK),
but to detach the vopt device from it.  We still remove the virtual
optical media.

Change-Id: Id2a3216ec06e95a538fa2f9f25463c490d69f81f
Closes-Bug: 1522222

commit_message:
Adding support for Manila-based shares in Sahara

The Sahara data processing service now supports manila
shares as a location for job binaries.  Also adding a unit
test for creation of manila-based job binaries.

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-10-15 21:40:53.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/servicegroup-api-control-plane.rst'], 'message': 'Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Previously-approved: liberty
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

Change-Id: I3cae9495373c4334fedb18b64d907f3a6ac5ab92
'}]
commit_message:
Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Previously-approved: liberty
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

Change-Id: I3cae9495373c4334fedb18b64d907f3a6ac5ab92

commit_message:
HOT outputs were merged

This commit does dot HOT template outputs (for Heat.HOT/1.0 format)
the same that was previously done for the inputs. Instead of generating
MuranoPL property per each output now all outputs are put into a
single 'templateOutputs' property. This allows to eliminate the constraints
on output names, not to have collisions with input names and remain
consistent with previous changes.

Change-Id: Ibbd0a2f410c55385cd3cb9e85ea135a36460afe7
Closes-Bug: #1520954

This cycle, to address these problems for our ever-growing set of
projects, the release management team is introducing a new tool for
handling release notes as files in-tree, to allow us to simply and
continuously build the release notes for stable branch point releases
and milestones on the master branch. The idea is to use small YAML
files, usually one per note or patch, to avoid merge conflicts on
backports and then to compile those files in a deterministic way
into a more readable document for readers. Files containing release
notes can be including in patches directly, or you can create a
separate patch with release notes if you want to document a feature
than spans several patches.  The tool is called Reno, and it currently
supports ReStructuredText and Sphinx for converting note input files
to HTML for publication.  Reno is git branch-aware, so we can have
separate release notes documents for each release series published
together from the master build.

-- Excerpted from Doug Hellmann's email to the mailing list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

For more information about Reno:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/

(cherry picked from commit 1519d5a0862178d9b5351447214835adb8b1ac2c)

Conflicts:
	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f
"}]
commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

This cycle, to address these problems for our ever-growing set of
projects, the release management team is introducing a new tool for
handling release notes as files in-tree, to allow us to simply and
continuously build the release notes for stable branch point releases
and milestones on the master branch. The idea is to use small YAML
files, usually one per note or patch, to avoid merge conflicts on
backports and then to compile those files in a deterministic way
into a more readable document for readers. Files containing release
notes can be including in patches directly, or you can create a
separate patch with release notes if you want to document a feature
than spans several patches.  The tool is called Reno, and it currently
supports ReStructuredText and Sphinx for converting note input files
to HTML for publication.  Reno is git branch-aware, so we can have
separate release notes documents for each release series published
together from the master build.

-- Excerpted from Doug Hellmann's email to the mailing list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

For more information about Reno:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f
(cherry picked from commit 1519d5a0862178d9b5351447214835adb8b1ac2c)

Conflicts:
	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f

off, repair or log. This leverages the oslo_config validation.

commit_message:
Neutron: Use generated configuration files if available

Generate the neutron core sample config files by using the oslo
generator. The files are generated with a .sample extension and
replace the static example configuration files.

Once the generation code is delivered, the static config files
will be removed.

Change-Id: Ic37a16b6cf8eb92030649f1fc8b198738a8cc104
Related-blueprint: autogen-neutron-conf-file
Partial-bug: #1199963
Depends-On: I1c6dc4e7d479f1b7c755597caded24a0f018c712
Co-Authored-By: Louis Taylor <louis@kragniz.eu>

commit_message:
Handle unbound allowed_address_pair FIP with DVR

If an allowed-address-pair port associated with a Floating IP is configured to
a VM port, the allowed-address-pair port will need to adopt the VM port's host
binding to be DVR serviceable.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I7f17630550e203535421c55721c9d9486d6435aa
Closes-Bug: #1475096

Update puppet-neutron Hiera config

To reflect new changes [1], we need to update the Hiera config, so we
don't have a warning when running Puppet.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/46d6242644d580d3bfa7c21e20a2bccefbc0db9e

subject: Remove pylint from the default list of tox targets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 21:07:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove pylint from the default list of tox targets

There is no such target defined, so when you execute it, it just runs
unit tests one more time. pylint calls are embedded into pep8 job, so
there is no need to have it separate in the first place.

Change-Id: I4f819cf92f32a95e9422f704f5f3e5930a7a1d1f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pylint from the default list of tox targets

There is no such target defined, so when you execute it, it just runs
unit tests one more time. pylint calls are embedded into pep8 job, so
there is no need to have it separate in the first place.

Change-Id: I4f819cf92f32a95e9422f704f5f3e5930a7a1d1f

subject: Support os-endpoint-type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-21 21:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Support os-endpoint-type

Ceilometerclient will always get publicURL even though we specify
endpoint type via arguments, it is because we call kesytone session
with wrong keyword argument, which should be interface rather than
endpoint_type.

see: https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py

Change-Id: Ic2b03bd900d913c7efd22c9b91dfaa79e0cdd4bc
Closes-Bug: #1396493
(cherry picked from commit dbf003ac6f39279cf1685d82b70d50a798d8b445)
'}]
commit_message:
Support os-endpoint-type

Ceilometerclient will always get publicURL even though we specify
endpoint type via arguments, it is because we call kesytone session
with wrong keyword argument, which should be interface rather than
endpoint_type.

see: https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py

Change-Id: Ic2b03bd900d913c7efd22c9b91dfaa79e0cdd4bc
Closes-Bug: #1396493
(cherry picked from commit dbf003ac6f39279cf1685d82b70d50a798d8b445)

keeping the controller thin.

This patch enables code coverage reporting during unit tests via
the `karma-coverage` plugin, and writes them in HTML form to the

commit_message:
Enable coverage reporting.

This patch enables code coverage reporting during unit tests via
the `karma-coverage` plugin, and writes them in HTML form to the
`cover` directory where they can be collected as part of the test
job output.

Change-Id: Ic280664eaf5d5f85acfaeb3f54b314129e9ed786

Add Project Service

This service is responsible for performing operations on multiple
projects at a time, so that we can remove this logic from our
controllers, making it easier to understand and test.

Change-Id: If3d0bde9b05bf44fbab7ff73b04c9028e1f298f0

This is the first step toward removing the business logic that currently
lives in the controllers, making them responsible for too much, into
specific objects that know how to perform them.

This allows us to have better tests and will also allow our controller
to be a lot thinner in the following commits (also allowing for
better/easier tests).

Change-Id: I5499876b9fbbfcd616a2f5d823c416f4fee3ddbe

commit_message:
Add factory to create Project models

This is the first step toward removing the business logic that currently
lives in the controllers, making them responsible for too much, into
specific objects that know how to perform them.

This allows us to have better tests and will also allow our controller
to be a lot thinner in the following commits (also allowing for
better/easier tests).

Co-Authored-By: Caio Carrara <ccarrara@thoughtworks.com>
Change-Id: I5499876b9fbbfcd616a2f5d823c416f4fee3ddbe

subject: Send extra_kernel_options on pxe_append_params
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1106, 'name': 'Ricardo Carrillo Cruz', 'email': 'ricardo.carrillo.cruz@gmail.com', 'username': 'rcc'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 13:37:51.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/ironic_config.yml'], 'message': 'Send extra_kernel_options on pxe_append_params

When we started using ironic pxe template, we lost the ability
to send extra_kernel_options. According to our conversations, this
should be sent on pxe_append_params.
As this element was already being used for screen, I decided to make
this step a bit more generalist, and also send the extra_kernel_options
on same task.

Change-Id: I6c4a5eeb64185cc91c29b169349fff426cc53334
'}]
commit_message:
Send extra_kernel_options on pxe_append_params

When we started using ironic pxe template, we lost the ability
to send extra_kernel_options. According to our conversations, this
should be sent on pxe_append_params.
As this element was already being used for screen, I decided to make
this step a bit more generalist, and also send the extra_kernel_options
on same task.

Change-Id: I6c4a5eeb64185cc91c29b169349fff426cc53334

subject: (WIP) Test pupept-openstack modules on more Puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 21:25:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': '(WIP) Test pupept-openstack modules on more Puppet

  This commit adds the jobs needed to test the old style of packaging
  opensource Puppet and the new PC1[1] style.

  Without this our modules are stuck at validating beaker tests on
  3.8.x.

  [1] http://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/4.3/reference/whered_it_go.html

Change-Id: Idfd92acab9c6bd74cfdb3352adbd431dce6507ae
'}]
commit_message:
(WIP) Test pupept-openstack modules on more Puppet

  This commit adds the jobs needed to test the old style of packaging
  opensource Puppet and the new PC1[1] style.

  Without this our modules are stuck at validating beaker tests on
  3.8.x.

  [1] http://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/4.3/reference/whered_it_go.html

Change-Id: Idfd92acab9c6bd74cfdb3352adbd431dce6507ae

subject: Support "server list" searching by both image name and ID.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-01 06:59:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Support "server list" searching by both image name and ID.

Nova API only supports list servers searching by image ID.
In OSC, we can support both image name and ID by mapping
the name to ID.

This patch also fix the inconsistent doc in .py and .rst files.

Closes-Bug: 1521492

Change-Id: I70613843f82d74732bd32a457cd4a31aba57825f
'}]
commit_message:
Support "server list" searching by both image name and ID.

Nova API only supports list servers searching by image ID.
In OSC, we can support both image name and ID by mapping
the name to ID.

This patch also fix the inconsistent doc in .py and .rst files.

Closes-Bug: 1521492

Change-Id: I70613843f82d74732bd32a457cd4a31aba57825f

commit_message:
Support "server list" searching by both flavor name and ID.

Nova API only supports list servers searching by flavor ID.
In OSC, we can support both flavor name and ID by mapping
the name to ID.

This patch also fix the inconsistent doc in .py and .rst files.

Partial-Bug: 1521492

Change-Id: I1d1a6aa91aef4e2846745babe8382481185fa96e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-19 13:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py', 'nova/tests/unit/servicegroup/test_db_servicegroup.py'], 'message': 'Handle DB failures in servicegroup DB driver

Fix an issue where when local conductor is used, the DB driver for
servicegroup will not handle transient DB problems gracefully.  The
patch makes the behavior consistent with messaging timeouts if remote
conductor is used.

Change-Id: Ie736e7b64ea4f60f78878c8713ce826702f9f05e
Closes-Bug: 1505471
(cherry picked from commit 5252bba03e43c71f90cb2a657e6a7f396d04be75)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle DB failures in servicegroup DB driver

Fix an issue where when local conductor is used, the DB driver for
servicegroup will not handle transient DB problems gracefully.  The
patch makes the behavior consistent with messaging timeouts if remote
conductor is used.

Change-Id: Ie736e7b64ea4f60f78878c8713ce826702f9f05e
Closes-Bug: 1505471
(cherry picked from commit 5252bba03e43c71f90cb2a657e6a7f396d04be75)

commit_message:
Disable clean_nodes by default

This patch sets the conductor/clean_nodes configuration option
for Ironic to False by default. To maintain the same behavior
of the old ramdisk.

The tripleoclient `openstack baremetal introspection bulk`
command needs to be fixed to account for the time it takes
to move from manageable to available in order to have cleaning
turned on by default.

Change-Id: I23c3e7ada3da8085957e86406527e9e5202bdd69
Closes-Bug: 1517449
(cherry picked from commit 246d1e8595945f74095b3ec70c63f493f615eed6)

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-11-17 21:36:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_legacy_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_router_info.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/legacy_router.py'], 'message': 'WIP fix DVR floating IP iptables rules

WIP: will update UT and commit message later

Currently it is possible for local VM traffic being forwarded directly to
the local floating IP instead of being routed via DVR edge router.

If two VMs on the same host are attached to the same local DVR router,
and at least one of the VMs has a floating IP associated with it,
then traffic between local VMs via the floating IP are passed directly
instead of being routed externally via the DVR edge router.

This is caused by DVR floating IP DNAT rules in the iptables PREROUTING chain.
The DNAT rules do not check if the traffic is ingress or egress before
changing the destination IP address of the packet. This patch will try
to fix that.

The patch also removes code which tries to add the floating IP to the rfp
device in the DVR local router namespace. Since DVR floating IP DNAT rules
no longer change destination IP address for egress traffic, the rfp device
hosting floating IP address will prevents egress traffic from reaching the
edge router.
Since rfp device in DVR local router namespace no longer hosts floating IPs,
we should modify methods such as "scan_fip_ports" to try scanning for
floating IP routes in the fip netns instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0
'}]
commit_message:
WIP fix DVR floating IP iptables rules

WIP: will update UT and commit message later

Currently it is possible for local VM traffic being forwarded directly to
the local floating IP instead of being routed via DVR edge router.

If two VMs on the same host are attached to the same local DVR router,
and at least one of the VMs has a floating IP associated with it,
then traffic between local VMs via the floating IP are passed directly
instead of being routed externally via the DVR edge router.

This is caused by DVR floating IP DNAT rules in the iptables PREROUTING chain.
The DNAT rules do not check if the traffic is ingress or egress before
changing the destination IP address of the packet. This patch will try
to fix that.

The patch also removes code which tries to add the floating IP to the rfp
device in the DVR local router namespace. Since DVR floating IP DNAT rules
no longer change destination IP address for egress traffic, the rfp device
hosting floating IP address will prevents egress traffic from reaching the
edge router.
Since rfp device in DVR local router namespace no longer hosts floating IPs,
we should modify methods such as "scan_fip_ports" to try scanning for
floating IP routes in the fip netns instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0

commit_message:
Add new alarm for the galera checks

This commit adds a new alarm to alert on the current mysql connection
count, based on percentage thresholds of configured maximum (80 warn,
90 critical)

Original github issue:
https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/issues/550

Depends on the following merging (this is the commit to add the new
metrics to the plugin):
https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-maas/pull/226

Change-Id: Iacd7a809b11fe3ca09deba8ee09fafbe08a13b03

commit_message:
[Sahara] Get urls of datasources safer

There are possible problems with retrieving datasources urls,
we can avoid that if we will wrap retrieving with try/except block.

Closes-bug: 1502854

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 14:55:32.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I18c626fb7dc8cc805117598946426e54fefed829
Closes-Bug: #1489059
'}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I18c626fb7dc8cc805117598946426e54fefed829
Closes-Bug: #1489059

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-19 12:52:44.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'Simplify LimitTests

Limit tests currently used for SQL backend testing are too complex.
Due to this complexity they could be used for SQL only. They assumed
possibility to create a domain, while it is not possible when LDAP
identity backend is used with multidomain support.

Simplify LimitTests and assume that a default domain is used for all
operations.

Change-Id: I77d581e03dae86c299ce2e1e56164dde3c4ad72a
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify LimitTests

Limit tests currently used for SQL backend testing are too complex.
Due to this complexity they could be used for SQL only. They assumed
possibility to create a domain, while it is not possible when LDAP
identity backend is used with multidomain support.

Simplify LimitTests and assume that a default domain is used for all
operations.

Change-Id: I77d581e03dae86c299ce2e1e56164dde3c4ad72a

commit_message:
db: Database Query Profiling

This spec proposes to introduce a way to measure db query execution
times using sqlalchemy events. This profiling information can be
very useful for tuning database performance.

Change-Id: I283877017e7f13c22eafae63ca5fd7456fa7a1ae
